Newborn babies with 
jaundice
Jaundice in newborn babies 
is	common	at	around	3–5	
days because their livers are 
immature. For most babies who 
are getting adequate milk, the 
jaundice usually goes away 
by	the	first	week	without	any	
special treatments. However 
jaundiced babies are usually 
quite sleepy so keep a record 
of their feeds and consult 
your
